tool.name: CreateWaterLevelTable

param.name: in_RAPID_discharge_file
param.dialogReference: The input of RAPID discharge result file in netCDF format.

param.name: in_start_date_time
param.dialogReference: The input starting date and time of the RAPID discharge result.

param.name: in_time_interval
param.dialogReference: The input time interval of flow rates in the RAPID discharge result. The unit is hours.

param.name: in_rating_curves_directory
param.dialogReference: The input folder where all rating curve csv files reside. Each rating curve file corresponds to one stream reach.

param.name: out_water_level_table
param.dialogReference: The output water level table includes fields of TimeValue, COMID (stream reach ID), H_ft (water level in feet), H_m (water level in meter), Q_cfs (stream flow in cubic feet per second), and Q_cumecs (stream flow in cubic meter per second). Each record in the table is for one reach at one time step.

tool.summary: Creates a water level table using stream ID and time as row dimensions from RAPID discharge file.
tool.usage:
• The input start date and time can be specified through the calendar window.

  • The name of the input rating curve file is hard-coded as "**** rating curve.csv" where **** represents the COMID number of the stream reach corresponding to the file.

  • The field names in the input rating curve csv file are hard-coded as " Height(ft)" and " Flowrate(ft^3/s)".

  • The output discharge table name is automatically updated into WaterLevel_Table.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Creates a water level table using stream ID and time as row dimensions from RAPID discharge file.
